data.title: Education News, Moncks Corner and Berkeley County
data.meta_description: Find the latest and most comprehensive education and schools news from the Berkeley Independent for Moncks Corner and Berkeley County.
data.text:
On Tuesday, July 30, 2024, the Charleston Regional Youth Apprenticeships (CRYA) program hosted its 11th annual Signing Day event at The College Center on Trident Technical College’s (TTC) Thornley Campus. The event celebrated 130 youth apprentices who officially signed with 58 employers in t…

The $37 million renovation and construction project at Trident Technical College’s Berkeley Campus is progressing toward an early 2025 groundbreaking. Renovations to the existing 74,000-square-foot facility, with 11,500-square-foot new construction, will transform the 40-plus-year-old campus…

With all of the attention usually given to students during back-to-school events, local Masonic Lodges unite to support teachers returning to the classroom.

Resilient parents are equipped to cope with the stress of everyday life and the occasional crisis. Parents often forget that to be the most competent parents they can be, they must prioritize their health and well-being, not just their children’s.

Lowcountry Connections Academy, a tuition-free, online public school serving students in grades K-12 based in Summerville, celebrated the school’s 82 graduating high school seniors at a May 23 ceremony at the Columbia Museum of Art.

The Berkeley 250 Francis Marion Commission will host Liberty Live: Art of Rev. War for Kids from 10 a.m.-noon Tuesday, June 25, and Tuesday, July 9, at Old Santee Canal Park, 900 Stony Landing Road in Moncks Corner.

At the more recent meeting of the Berkeley County Board of Education, members unanimously approved the first reading of the FY 24-25 budget that significantly increases teacher pay while providing relief to taxpayers.

The South Carolina State Fair has announced the 2024 recipients of its annual “Ride of Your Life” Scholarship program. This year, 53 high school seniors across the state received these $10,000 scholarships.

The Berkeley Chamber of Commerce will unveil the first of five Resource Hubs at 10 a.m. Thursday, May 23, at the Keith School Museum, 1509 Clements Ferry Road.

What was an old locker room at Stratford High is now the school’s newest weight room – with a splash of pink.

The St. John’s Christian Academy (SJCA) Board of Directors has selected Becky Ellison as the Head of School. Ellison will begin her duties directing and overseeing campus operations and school leadership with a contract starting June 1.

The Berkeley County Library System (BCLS) is hosting a Spotlight on Local Women of Note from 5:30-6:30 p.m. Friday, March 22, at Moncks Corner Library, 1003 Highway 52 in Moncks Corner.

Berkeley County Library System (BCLS) is co-hosting “Garden and Grow: Vegetables” with Christopher Burtt, Clemson University Cooperative Extension Area Horticulture Agent, for Berkeley, Charleston and Dorchester counties, from 1-2 p.m. Thursday, March 14, at Goose Creek Library, 325 Old Monc…

Imagine being on a stage, but not just any stage – a theater on Broadway in Manhattan.

“The Verdant Beauty of Cypress,” drawn by Stratford High School senior Ash Trespicio, will grace the cover of the annual Home Telecom Directory this year after winning first place in the 2024 Home Telecom Directory Art Challenge competition.

In a collaborative effort to provide educational resources for the community, the Berkeley County Library System (BCLS) is co-hosting the Lowcountry Educational Admissions Representative Network (L.E.A.R.N.) Spring College Fair. The event is from 2-5 p.m. Friday, March 15, and will take plac…

The Berkeley County Library System (BCLS) is expanding its Information. Inspiration. Illumination collection. Two new additions, focused on Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEAM), are set to provide insights and practical applications for library users.

Berkeley County School District teachers, staff members and administrators spent Friday, Feb. 16, participating in a series of workshops and classroom sessions as part of an annual professional development event known as BCSD Conference Day; this year's theme was “Together We Thrive.” Sessio…

The Berkeley County Library System (BCLS) is partnering with Feld Entertainment to bring young readers an opportunity with the Jurassic World Live Tour: Read Five Books Reading Program. Aimed at children ages 2 to 12, the program runs until March 10, offering families a way to combine readin…

The Steinberg Law Firm’s 2024 College Scholarship Program is now open. This year’s program offers five $1,000 scholarships to high school seniors and current college students who are residents of South Carolina.

Berkeley ONEderland wrapping day took place the week before Christmas. Volunteers wrapped presents donated by community members for more than 200 BCSD students. Berkeley ONEderland is a program set up by Berkeley County School District social workers that gives gifts and other valuable donat…

Kaitlyn Nash, of Moncks Corner, and 25 other first-generation students were the first inductees into Wofford's Theta Omicron Chapter of Alpha Alpha Alpha on Nov. 8.

Berkeley Preparatory Academy earned four different honors in recognition of its performance in the 2022-2023 school year this past November at the Charter Institute at Erskine’s Academic Showcase.

The Trident Literacy Association received a $5,000 grant Tuesday, Oct. 31, from the Sisters of Charity Foundation of South Carolina. The foundation awards grants to nonprofits striving to reduce poverty throughout South Carolina. Trident Literacy Association was part of the Immediate Needs c…

Charleston Southern University has announced the launch of Buc Promise, a new renewable scholarship for Pell-eligible South Carolina residents with a minimum 3.5 high school GPA.

While wars still wage and discrimination and division still exist, the effort to remind younger generations that, “Those who don’t learn from history are doomed to repeat it” is as important as ever.

The 2023 Govie Writing Awards, presented by the SC Governor’s School for the Art and Humanities Creative Writing Department, is now accepting submissions of short fiction and poetry by South Carolina students in grades 6-12. Students can submit their original works to www.scgsah.org/writinga…

Recently, I was asked to help define the parishes of old, and where were the boundaries? That’s a question not really easy to answer because of all the changes that have taken place in our (present-day Berkeley) county, and with your understanding neither the original Berkeley County, nor th…

In response to a public records request filed by the American Civil Liberties Union of South Carolina (ACLU-SC), the Berkeley County School District has released a list of 93 books that have been challenged and are under review.

The Berkeley County Coroner’s Office was notified at 4:03 p.m. Friday, Aug. 25, by some bystanders about a child being found deceased inside a car at Bishop England High School, 363 Seven Farms Drive.

Bryce Ellison, front row, fourth from left, of Moncks Corner, completed the requirements for an associate degree in nursing from Central Carolina Technical College. Graduates of the associate degree in nursing (ADN) program are prepared for careers as technical nurses in acute care, long-ter…

Berkeley County Library System (BCLS) is hosting a monthly Wonderful World of Crafts, Wednesday, August 9, 2023, from 4–5 pm at Sangaree Library, located at 595 Sangaree Parkway, Summerville. Customers will be painting on an 8 x 10 art canvas. Sangaree Library is proud to give customers a sa…

At the regularly scheduled Berkeley County Board of Education meeting on July 17, members of the community stepped forward to voice concerns of their own and of Berkeley County School District faculty regarding teacher reassignment. This issue continues to be a hot-button topic in light of r…
